intro: Cratystylis microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved cratystylis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of northeastern Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Cratystylis microphylla is often found in moist soils near streams or in dense forest interiors.
